Familiar.name: Familiar
Familiar.description: Estás vinculado mágicamente a una pequeña alimaña cuyo tamaño no puede superar el de un gato. Podéis hablar mediante telepatía cuando se encuentre cerca de ti. Elige dos acciones en las que destaque, que puedes resolver con tu propio valor en Invocación. Tira 0d en cualquier otra cosa. Si alguien lo revienta, quedará eliminado de la escena, pero se recuperará mágicamente durante la siguiente recuperación. Puedes sufrir estrés para lanzar un hechizo de nivel 1 a través de tu familiar

Pack Mule.name: Mula de carga
Pack Mule.description: Puedes llevar una carga inmensa. Obtienes dos espacios de equipo, una defensa basada en ello y un espacio de suministros adicionales. ¿Dónde llevas todas esas cosas?
Pack Mule.supplyDescription: Obtienes dos espacios de equipo y un espacio de suministros adicionales

Poisoner.name: Envenenador
Poisoner.description: Se te da muy bien fabricar o conseguir venenos. Tienes un suministro regular de los siguientes venenos de nivel 1: cegador, desorientador, ralentizador y nauseabundo. También ganas dos espacios de suministro adicionales que solo puedes usar con ellos.
Poisoner.supplyDescription: Tienes un suministro regular de los siguientes venenos de nivel 1: cegador, desorientador, ralentizador y nauseabundo. También ganas dos espacios de suministro adicionales que solo puedes usar con ellos.

Defiler.name: Defiler
Defiler.description: Draw a 4-segment clock on your sheet. Tick it once each time you defile something sacred or beautiful that is antithetical to your god’s domains. When the clock is full, a tier 2 ritual immediately manifests in that location and you start a new clock.

Wild Knowledge.name: Wild Knowledge
Wild Knowledge.description: You can spend stress to establish a fact about plants, animals, or the weather. You take +1d when you act on that knowledge.

Dramatic Reveal.name: Dramatic Reveal
Dramatic Reveal.description: You can reveal yourself with impeccable timing, taking advantage of people’s shock. You take +1d on any action immediately after you reveal your true form.

Hunted.name: Hunted
Hunted.description: Any time your cover is completely blown and you don’t cover your tracks, the GM can pocket minor blowback.

Ingenuity.name: Ingenuity
Ingenuity.description: You can spend stress to perform an incredible feat of creation, like mixing concoctions on the fly to create a powerful combined effect, slapping together a temporary simple contraption, or ignoring volatility in monster science creations.

Creative Frenzy.name: Creative Frenzy
Creative Frenzy.description: On a success while working on a crafting downtime project, the downtime action isn’t consumed. You also gain a downtime action which you can only use to craft.
Creative Frenzy.downtimeDescription: On a success while working on a crafting downtime project, the downtime action isn’t consumed. Extra Craft action

Beastform.name: Beastform
Beastform.description: You can spend stress to assume the form of a beast. While in this form, one of your actions swaps ratings with another and you gain either Primal Ability or a special ability from another calling. You also gain a second dark impulse while in this form. All of these are chosen when you first take this ability.

Weaving the Web.name: Weaving the Web
Weaving the Web.description: On a success during a flashback or downtime action to interact with contacts, you gain a dark heart. You also gain a downtime action which you can only use to contact a vile friend, faction, or other NPC.

Dark Mind.name: Dark Mind
Dark Mind.description: You can compel other PCs to action just as if the GM had compelled them. If they accept, you gain a dark heart. If they decline, you take stress. The GM is still the final judge of what is an appropriate compel.

Tactician.name: Tactician
Tactician.description: Battle plans are the key to your success. You take +1d on your first action after an engagement roll. You also gain a defense against raid plans going off track.

Mindspeak.name: Mindspeak
Mindspeak.description: You can communicate telepathically with anyone you can see, though this communication is one-way and they always know who is speaking to them.

Breath.name: Breath
Breath.growthPathDescription1: You can unleash your breath as a powerful blast, a tier 1 effect of your type.
Breath.growthPathDescription2: You can spend stress to increase the power of your blast to a tier 2 effect.
Breath.growthPathDescription3: When you go hard with a blast, you increase the tier by 1 instead of gaining +effect. On a success when going hard, you gain a dark heart.

Slumber.name: Slumber
Slumber.description: You do not have revelry or count loot, instead rolling the gathered loot to slumber. You do not have gear or supply and can never spend gold.

Deception.name: Deception
Deception.psiActionDescription: You deceive the minds of others into believing what you want.
Deception.primalDomainDescription1: You can spend stress to make anyone not aware of your presence simply unable to notice you until you give them cause to. This lasts for several moments. Once noticed, it is much harder to use it against them again.
Deception.primalDomainDescription2: On a critical with a deception power, you gain a dark heart. On a failure, you can choose to spend stress to change the result to a mixed instead.

Overload.name: Overload
Overload.description: You open yourself to a torrent of power. You take +1d when you go hard with a spell, but you can't resist any consequences from the roll. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Spirit Whispers.name: Spirit Whispers
Spirit Whispers.description: Your control of chaotic situations pulls information from surrounding spirits. On a success when resisting, you can ask the GM a question or to reveal a secret related to the situation. You also gain a defense against lies, trickery, and stealth.

Scrutiny.name: Scrutiny
Scrutiny.description: You can spend stress to establish a flaw in a structure or some machinery you can see. You take +1d when you act on that knowledge.

Grotesque Mutations.name: Grotesque Mutations
Grotesque Mutations.description: When you shift into a form, you can instead shift into a grotesque version of the form, such as having multiple heads or the limbs are backwards. You take +1d when horrifying someone with your appearance and on a success, you gain a dark heart.

Opportunist.name: Opportunist
Opportunist.description: You take +1d on a roll when acting immediately after an ally fails a resistance roll. How do you leverage their failure to your own advantage?

Commander.name: Commander
Commander.description: You exert your will to bolster your minions. You can spend stress or a dark heart to give a minion pack +1d on a roll. You also gain a defense against minion failure.

Prowler.name: Prowler
Prowler.description: You can spend stress to perform an incredible feat of agility, like slipping unimpeded through a mob, leaping safely from a high tower, or hiding in plain sight.

Strings.name: Strings
Strings.description: You can spend stress to have an ally remember your voice in their head, allowing them to reroll a failure. If they roll a success, you gain a dark heart. What criticism or advice did you previously impart on them?

Pride.name: Pride
Pride.description: You instill a deep sense of yourself into anything you create. When you or someone else rolls a critical using something you crafted, you gain a dark heart.

Assault.name: Assault
Assault.description: You’re a force to be reckoned with. On a success in close combat, you can also (choose one): cleave into a nearby enemy - destroy their shield or armor - send them flying.

Reaper.name: Reaper
Reaper.description: When you deliver a killing blow with a weapon, you reap the soul of your victim. You can expend this soul later to cast a spell without spending stress, also taking +1d on the roll. You can only hold one reaped soul at a time.

Shifting Tricks.name: Shifting Tricks
Shifting Tricks.description: You push your shifting powers to the limit and have learned a few useful tricks. You can spend stress to do one of the following for a few moments (choose one): climb on walls like a spider - grow a weapon from your body - turn into a puddle of goo.

Grit.name: Grit
Grit.description: You don't go down easy. On a failure when resisting, you can immediately roll an extra 1d that counts towards the roll. If the result is a success, it counts as a critical.

Unholy Rituals.name: Unholy Rituals
Unholy Rituals.description: You gain a downtime action which you can only use to incant rituals. On a success when incanting a ritual, you gain a dark heart.
Unholy Rituals.downtimeDescription: Extra Incant Rituals Action (On a success when incanting a ritual, you gain a dark heart)

Sorcery.name: Sorcery
Sorcery.description: You have mastered a magic path (choose one): enchantment - evocation - force mastery - illusion - necromancy - pyromancy. You can spend stress to Invoke tier 2 and tier 3 spells of your path.

Stalker.name: Stalker
Stalker.description: Your lurking presence forces foolish action. On a success while moving stealthily, NPCs near you (choose one): do something stupid due to paranoia - reveal a secret.

Signature Elixir.name: Signature Elixir
Signature Elixir.description: You have a steady supply of a single specific tier 2 concoction and you gain 2 supply slots which you can only use for it.
Signature Elixir.supplyDescription: Two supply slots for a specific Tier 2 Concoction

Terror.name: Terror
Terror.description: Others can't help but reveal their fears. You can spend stress to establish what someone’s worst fear is. You take +1d when you act on that knowledge.

Tyranny.name: Tyranny
Tyranny.growthPathDescription1: Your dungeon’s imps take +1d on their downtime action and you control what they work on, not the GM. You also take +1d on power struggles.
Tyranny.growthPathDescription2: Your reputation brings in minions devoted to serve you. They have the companion and expendable upgrades. They will also perform one downtime action each downtime without asking for gold.
Tyranny.growthPathDescription3: You roam the region around your dungeon, reigning terror. State a goal and start a faction clock representing it. Once per downtime, you can awaken from your slumber and take a downtime action to work towards the goal.

Embodiment.name: Embodiment
Embodiment.description: You take on physical and personality traits of your faces. Each face has one action that it is especially good at and you act as if your rating is always at least 2d with it. On a critical while with that action while in that face, you gain 1 wicked xp.

Psionics.name: Psionics
Psionics.description: Psionics: You can spend stress to manifest tier 2 and 3 powers, taking dice penalties like a spell.

Thought Thief.name: Thought Thief
Thought Thief.description: You can skim the surface thoughts of those unaware of your true nature. When you enter a scene shapeshifted, you can establish a single fact that one of them has on their minds at that moment. You take +1d when you act on that knowledge.

Hide.name: Hide
Hide.growthPathDescription1: Your scales (choose one): have an edge - become a tier 1 magic item of your type. Appropriate edges may be camouflaged, slippery, or spiked. You also gain a defense that comes from your scales.
Hide.growthPathDescription2: On a success when resisting a physical attack, you can (choose one): break their weapon - manifest your type (tier 1) - strike fear in their heart.
Hide.growthPathDescription3: You can spend stress to manifest an aura of your type around you that lasts for a few moments. When someone enters the aura, make a fortune roll using Invoke to see if they’re affected by a tier 1 effect of your type.

Smite.name: Smite
Smite.description: Designate a weapon as your unholy weapon. It's now your magic focus. On a success when attacking someone with it, you can spend stress to immediately affect the target with a tier 1 spell without rolling.

Shapeshifting.name: Shapeshifting
Shapeshifting.description: You can spend stress to physically change your appearance and voice for a few moments into the form of a humanoid you can currently see. This includes the clothes they’re wearing, but not items they’re carrying.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description: You can spend stress to perform an incredible feat of strength, like throwing a large boulder, tackling a charging horse, or facing off against a much larger foe on equal footing.

Menace.name: Menace
Menace.description: You put the torment of others over your own safety. You take +1d when you go hard to intimidate or humiliate someone. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Eye Rays.name: Eye Rays
Eye Rays.description: Your eyes have magical eye rays that act as a very narrow magical path. You can cast tier 1 spells with them and can also spend stress to cast a tier 2 spell, taking -1d on the roll as normal. However, you can’t cast tier 3 spells.

Feral Senses.name: Feral Senses
Feral Senses.description: Animal blood runs through your veins, causing your senses to extend twice as far as normal. You take +1d when tracking or surveying an area. You also gain a defense against surprise.

Living Weapon.name: Living Weapon
Living Weapon.description: Your body is a deadly weapon and has edges (choose two): concealed - longreach - grappling - ranged - pulverizing - terrifying. How did you end up this way?

Intuition.name: Intuition
Intuition.description: Others are an open book to you. You can spend stress to establish a target’s emotional state, though it must be a reasonable emotion for them to be feeling. You take +1d when you act on that knowledge.

Feasting.name: Feasting
Feasting.description: You no longer clear all stress automatically each recovery. Instead, you feast on brains to handle your stress and hunger. This is possible to do during any scene. This requires a living victim that is subdued or restrained and you’re very vulnerable while you take the time to feast.

Taskmaster.name: Taskmaster
Taskmaster.description: You gain a downtime action which you can only use to recruit minions or sacrifice to have minions perform a downtime action without paying them gold.
Taskmaster.downtimeDescription: Extra Recruit Minions Action or free Minion Downtime Action

Bizarre Body.name: Bizarre Body
Bizarre Body.description: You can float through the air with supernatural buoyancy. You don’t have gear and therefore no gear defense, but you do have supply. Your teeth are also as dangerous as a weapon.

Fury.name: Fury
Fury.description: When you suffer injury or humiliation, you take +1d if you immediately lash out. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Weaving.name: Weaving
Weaving.description: You effortlessly blend witchcraft with the material or mundane. On a success when casting a spell, you take +1d on any follow-up using a different action.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: You recognize the perfect timing to strike. You take +1d when you catch someone by surprise. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: You can speak the Light Tongue, albeit with a strong, monstrous accent. How does a monster like you even learn to speak the language of civilization?

Rebuke.name: Rebuke
Rebuke.description: You teach those who challenge you a harsh lesson. On a success when resisting, you take +1d if you immediately act against them. On a critical when resisting, you also (choose one): strike fear in their heart or make them doubt their path.

Grafting.name: Grafting
Grafting.description: If you go feral while assuming the forms of one of your faces, that face permanently grafts itself onto you. It can no longer be replaced, taking up one of your three slots. It also costs you two stress to resist compels from it.

War Drums.name: War Drums
War Drums.description: A steady beat emanates throughout your dungeon, keeping everyone focused on the task at hand.
War Drums.downtimeDescription: Each player can tick a project clock once per downtime, but each tick must go to a different clock.

Inquisitor.name: Inquisitor
Inquisitor.description: You feel deep satisfaction in breaking the will of others. On a success when torturing prisoners, you gain a dark heart and learn twice as much information as normal. You also gain a downtime action which you can only use for this purpose.

Slippery.name: Slippery
Slippery.description: You're tough to pin down. On a success when resisting an enemy attack, you can also (choose one): disappear from their sight - pick their pocket - reposition behind them.

Gear Locker.name: Gear Locker
Gear Locker.description: You always get geared up before leaving the dungeon. You gain a supply slot and have a steady supply of the following concoctions and gear: climbing gear - glowsticks - smoke bombs - tar bombs - throwing weapons - thunderstones - traps.
Gear Locker.supplyDescription: You gain a supply slot and have a steady supply of the following concoctions and gear: climbing gear - glowsticks - smoke bombs - tar bombs - throwing weapons - thunderstones - traps.
Gear Locker.downtimeDescription: Each player can tick a project clock once per downtime, but each tick must go to a different clock.

Wild Brews.name: Wild Brews
Wild Brews.description: You can brew potions of any tier from all witchcraft paths. You also gain a downtime action which you can only use to brew potions.

Hunting Pet.name: Hunting Pet
Hunting Pet.description: You have a hunting pet or pack instead of minions. It has the companion upgrade and knows tricks (choose two): cause confusion - fetch - herd prey - locate prey - surprise attack. Your pet takes +1d when performing known tricks.

Domination.name: Domination
Domination.psiActionDescription: You dominate the minds of others to do your bidding.
Domination.primalDomainDescription1: You can perform a tier 1 ritual to turn a subdued adventurer into a thrall, occupying your minion slot. It has the companion and mindset (loyal) upgrades. It also has an extra action with a rating equal to its tier and a calling ability that represents something it can do. If the ability requires it to spend stress, you can spend stress for them.
Domination.primalDomainDescription2: You can spend stress to create a spherical null-field, within which all magic ceases to function. Anyone who attempts to cast receives a sharp mental rebuke. The sphere itself is crystalline and vulnerable to physical attack or your concentration being broken.

Battlemaster.name: Battlemaster
Battlemaster.description: You can spend stress to perform an incredible feat of athletics, like throwing an axe a great distance, maneuvering nearly anywhere on the field of battle, or facing off against a group of foes on equal footing.

Voices.name: Voices
Voices.description: You do not have a dark impulse, instead being compelled to act by the faces.

Thrill of the Hunt.name: Thrill of the Hunt
Thrill of the Hunt.description: You can spend stress to establish a small, momentary weakness in your prey. You gain +effect when you exploit this on your next roll to stalk, catch, or bring them down. On a success, you gain a dark heart.

Scout.name: Scout
Scout.description: You make a habit of roaming the surface and scouting out targets. While choosing a raid plan, you can establish a weakness you know about in your target’s defenses. During the raid, you can also spend stress to establish a second fact.

Missed a Spot.name: Missed a Spot
Missed a Spot.description: Each downtime, you get two ticks which can be distributed to any project clocks started by your allies. What errors do you point out in their work?
Missed a Spot.downtimeDescription: Two ticks which for project clocks started by allies. What errors do you point out in their work?

Rawhide.name: Rawhide
Rawhide.description: Your thick hide protects you from harm. You take +1d when resisting physical attacks and spend 1 less stress when you do so. What makes your hide so tough?

Overseer.name: Overseer
Overseer.description: Your minions can resist consequences using their actions, though you take or clear stress instead of them when they do. Explain how you warned them ahead of time to handle the consequence. you also get an extra downtime action which you can only use to recruit minions.

Witchcraft.name: Witchcraft
Witchcraft.description: You have mastered a magic path (choose one): bloodreading - soothsaying - spiritcalling - stormstrike - wildheart. You can spend stress to Invoke tier 2 and tier 3 spells of your path.

Cohort.name: Cohort
Cohort.description: Your minions are always elite, with the mindset (loyal) and companion upgrades. They also have an additional upgrade (choose one): equipped - mindset (fearless) - trained - versatile.

Slumber Rolls.name: Slumber Rolls
Slumber Rolls.description:
Failure: Your slumber is disturbed and you overdo it, wreaking havoc on the dungeon or surrounding countryside in some way.

Mixed: You slumber restlessly, gaining a dark heart. 

Success: You slumber deeply, filling all of your dark hearts as you dream of (choose one): an interesting faction scene - the location of great treasure - secrets of the past. Establish a fact you saw.

Critical: Also, you awaken invigorated and can increase a type effect’s tier by 1 once this cycle!

Grand Sorcery.name: Grand Sorcery
Grand Sorcery.description: You can choose a second path for your Sorcery core ability and can cast from any sorcery path with only a single magic focus.

Prototype.name: Prototype
Prototype.description: Start a single tier 2 or 3 contraption crafting clock. You can use this unfinished contraption as normal. Any time you make a dire roll using it, it ticks the crafting clock once. When the clock is full, the contraption is made and you start a new clock.

Monster Science.name: Monster Science
Monster Science.description: You fully believe in your creations. You take +1d when you go hard with a concoction or contraption, but you can't resist any consequences from the roll. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Unseen Hand.name: Unseen Hand
Unseen Hand.description: When you assist an ally, you only take consequences if they roll a failure. If they roll a critical, you clear 1 stress. Why do they not know you're helping them?

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: On a success when resisting magical effects, you also (choose one): absorb the spell and clear 1 stress - establish a quirk about the caster’s power - reflect the spell at the caster.

Acolytes.name: Acolytes
Acolytes.description: Your minions are fanatic devotees of your god. They have the mindset (zealous) and companion upgrades and will use a downtime action to incant a ritual each downtime without asking for gold.

Maniac.name: Maniac
Maniac.description: You think nothing of risking life and limb. You take +1d when you go hard and put your own body on the line, but you can't resist any consequences from the roll. On a critical, you clear 1 stress.

Brewmaster.name: Brewmaster
Brewmaster.description: When you make a concoction, you always make 1 extra dose, even on a failure. You gain a downtime action which you can only use to brew concoctions.

Flight.name: Flight
Flight.growthPathDescription1: Your wings are powerful enough to fly, though you must spend stress to launch yourself into the air when under threat. You lack fine control over your flight.
Flight.growthPathDescription2: Your wings grow stronger and more dependable and you now have even fine control over your flight. You also gain a defense against missile attacks.
Flight.growthPathDescription3: You can spend stress to perform an incredible feat of flight, like dive bombing at high speeds or generating huge gusts of wind. You can also use this to carry a rider or haul large cargo.

Trick Shots.name: Trick Shots
Trick Shots.description: You can pull off improbable (but not impossible) shots with a ranged weapon, like ricocheting a projectile off a wall or shooting through one target and hitting another. You ignore any circumstances towards effect from the difficulty, but you must explain how you pulled off the shot.

Wrath.name: Wrath
Wrath.description: Your desire for payback fuels your witchcraft. When you cast a spell immediately after a resistance roll, you take +1d and it costs no stress to cast.

Funeral Pyre.name: Funeral Pyre
Funeral Pyre.description: Your warrior culture honors the dead, burning their bodies as a sendoff to the afterlife. When minions die in combat, any minions that witness it gain morale and will perform a downtime action during the next downtime without asking for gold.
Funeral Pyre.downtimeDescription: When minions die in combat, any minions that witness it gain morale and will perform a downtime action during the next downtime without asking for gold.

Bulwark.name: Bulwark
Bulwark.description: You're the rock on which your allies lean. You take +1d when resisting consequences for an ally. On a success, the ally takes +1d on any follow-up action.

Perfect Entrance.name: Perfect Entrance
Perfect Entrance.description: You can spend stress to appear in any scene already shifted into one of your faces as long as you can reasonably explain how that face got there. When you do so, make a separate engagement roll to determine how good your cover is.

Fervent Aura.name: Fervent Aura
Fervent Aura.description: When you would become bloodied or be killed, you can designate a nearby minion to become bloodied or die instead. When a minion pack dies in this way, they can perform a final action and you gain a dark heart.

Bonded Spirit.name: Bonded Spirit
Bonded Spirit.description:
You have a magically bonded spirit or pack instead of minions. It
has the companion upgrade and powers (choose two): become
invisible - manifest physically - possess the weak-minded - reveal
information about the past. It can use each once per cycle.

Faces.name: Faces
Faces.description:
You can spend stress to slide a copy of a completely helpless, living humanoid’s face off of them. Draw some of its distinguishing features below, then add a few details about the owner. You can shapeshift into a face’s owner for as long as you like without spending stress, also gaining the ability to
speak their language while shifted. You can only keep three faces at a time and can replace one when you steal a new face.

Power Source.name: Power Source
Power Source.description: In a forge, your sanctum is a source of power fueling your dungeon, such as a volcano, a steamworks, or a waterwheel.
Power Source.downtimeDescription: During downtime, you can take +1d on a single downtime action. During dungeon defense, you can take +1d on a single lock, trap, or trick on your list of dungeon duties.

Meddling.name: Meddling
Meddling.description: You excel at manipulating factions from within. You gain a downtime action that you can only use to try to tick faction clocks forwards or backwards. You’re assumed to be using forms during this time, though you don’t need to pay stress.
Meddling.downtimeDescription: Extra Action to try to tick Faction Clocks forwards or backwards

Meticulous.name: Meticulous
Meticulous.description: On a success during a flashback, you gain a dark heart and an ally takes +1d on any follow-up roll. Support: After an ally rolls, you can spend a dark heart to give them an additional +1d on the roll. How did you prepare them for the challenges to come?

Paranoia.name: Paranoia
Paranoia.description: Your dark impulse is paranoid which makes it difficult for you to leave the dungeon, strongly preferring to instead send minions on raids. You must spend 2 stress to suppress any compels outside of the dungeon.

Hunger.name: Hunger
Hunger.description:
Hunger dominates your thoughts. Failing to feast on the brain of a living, intelligent creature at least once per cycle weakens you. You become bloodied during recovery if you failed to feast during the previous cycle.

Weak brains barely satiate your hunger. This sets your stress clock to 3 ticks regardless of whether you had more or less ticks before.

Delicious brains from a worthy foe or from a victim with particularly interesting memories completely satiate your hunger. You clear all stress.

Scavenger.name: Scavenger
Scavenger.description: On a success while surveying or traversing a risky area, you can (choose one): find a piece of mundane gear - tick an edge crafting clock - harvest a tier 2 concoction.

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
Telekinesis.psiActionDescription: You control objects in the environment around you.
Telekinesis.primalDomainDescription1: You can levitate as easily as you can walk. You can also spend stress to fly through the sky as swiftly as a hawk for a short time.
Telekinesis.primalDomainDescription2: You have honed your telekinetic abilities to maintain a reflexive guard around you. You can spend stress to fully resist a physical attack as if you had used a defense. What form does your guard take?

Control.name: Control
Control.description: You fluidly control a fight. On a success when resisting an attack in close combat, you can also (choose one): disarm them - redirect the attack - reposition them nearby.

Joy of Battle.name: Joy of Battle
Joy of Battle.description: You love nothing more than your own excellence in battle. On a critical while engaged in combat, you clear 1 stress and gain a dark heart.

Sticky Fingers.name: Sticky Fingers
Sticky Fingers.description: You always manage to come away with something of value. You get 1 extra gold each loot roll and can control up to 4 gold without raising suspicion. Also, once during each raid, you can establish the location of some good loot nearby.

Telepathy.name: Telepathy
Telepathy.psiActionDescription: You read the thoughts and memories of others.
Telepathy.primalDomainDescription1: You’re constantly scanning the surface thoughts of those around you. You’re never surprised by living creatures and can always act first. You can spend stress to have the GM reveal a secret about an NPC the first time you meet them.
Telepathy.primalDomainDescription2: Delicious brains can’t help but reveal their intentions to you. Any adventurer using a defensive move against your psionic powers takes -1d. When you resist adventurer offensive moves, you take +1d.

Artificer.name: Artificer
Artificer.description: You gain a downtime action which you can only use to incant rituals to make magic items. These rituals also require one less special requirement than usual.
Artificer.downtimeDescription: Extra Incant Rituals Action to make magic items

Wordplay.name: Wordplay
Wordplay.description: On a success when resisting with Banter, Threaten, or Trick, you can also (choose one): deflect blame - plant a false idea - have the GM reveal a secret.

Channeling.name: Channeling
Channeling.description: You can spend stress to Invoke tier 2 and tier 3 spells of your chosen deity’s domains. Each god has two domains which act as magic paths.

Lair.name: Lair
Lair.growthPathDescription1: Once per dungeon defense, you can manifest your type as a trap, trick, or lock anywhere in the dungeon. You can spend dark hearts on these rolls.
Lair.growthPathDescription2: You can manifest your type a second time as a trap, trick, or lock anywhere in the dungeon. On a success, you gain a dark heart.
Lair.growthPathDescription3: You can now have a maximum of three dark hearts. After you successfully defend your dungeon from invasion, you fill all of your dark hearts.

Vile Form.name: Vile Form
Vile Form.description: You can spend stress to assume an amorphous form for a few moments, such as a swarm or a fog. You gain any strengths and  weaknesses the form possesses and can roll Invoke to perform actions it would excel at. All of these are chosen when you first take this ability.

Masterful Liar.name: Masterful Liar
Masterful Liar.description: You excel at lying when you go all in on a falsehood. You take +1d when you go hard to tell a lie. On a success, you gain a dark heart.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.growthPathDescription1: Your natural weaponry (choose one): have an edge - become a tier 1 magic item of your type. Appropriate edges may be corrosive, powerful, or terrifying.
Ferocity.growthPathDescription2: You add another edge or the magic item increases to tier 2. On a critical when using your natural weaponry, you gain a dark heart.
Ferocity.growthPathDescription3: On a success in close combat, you can spend stress to (choose one): cleave into a nearby enemy - manifest your type (tier 1) - swallow them - swat them away.
